term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - mass distribution ratio in chromatography
term.title: mass distribution ratio

item.text: The fraction (1- R) of a component in the stationary phase divided by the fraction (R) in the mobile phase: This term is recommended in preference to the term capacity factor frequently used in the chromatographic literature.

item.alttext: Dm = amount of substance in the stationary phase/amount of component in the mobile phase
item.latex: D_{\text{m}}=\frac{\text{amount of substance in the stationary phase}}{\text{amount of component in the mobile phase}}

sources.item: PAC, 1993, 65, 2373. 'Nomenclature for liquid-liquid distribution (solvent extraction) (IUPAC Recommendations 1993)' on page 2384 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199365112373)
